column2: ## iterate over all columns of our dataset and test if there are any NaN contained
for(i in 1:ncol(ds1))
if(any(is.nan(ds1[,i])))
cat('There are ' , length(is.nan(ds1[,i])), 'NaNs in column ', colnames(ds1)[i], '\n')
} else
cat('There are no NaNs in column ', colnames(ds1)[i], '\n')
